result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua C Todd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Any payments made are to be applied to the restitution before any fines/costs
*Joint and several with Shannon Meating
*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.

*Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs 
*Use only 1 pharmacy to obtain prescription medications 
*Sign all necessary releases to monitor compliance with this condition
*Provide agent with a list of drugs and keep it up to date on any prescriptions 
*Cooperate with any other assessments or counseling deemed appropriate by the agent 
*No contact with the victims listed in the restitution request:  William Neeb, Kurtzweil Antiques, Grace Kulas and Jadeco Stamp and Hobby. 
*Provide DNA sample 
*Court will allow early discharge if all conditions are met and restitution is paid in full

*AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
*Agent can rely on any prior AODA assessment if deemed appropriate

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua C Todd

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: for Early Discharge from Probation Pursuant to 973.09(3)(d) /s/ TBE 09/26/17

Defendant Joshua C Todd in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
9:55 a.m. Court calls the case.  

State files Statement of Uncharged Read-ins.
State files Amended Information. 
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Atty Halverson received a copy of the amended information and waives its reading. 

Defendant enters a plea of:  Counts 1 thru 5 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Counts 1 thru 5.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halverson makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 - 
30 days jail - STAYED
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Allowed to serve one half on the Electornic Monitor if he's qualified after an assessment by the sheriff's department. 

Count 2 - 
30 days jail, consecutive to Count 1 - STAYED -
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Allowed to serve one half on the Electornic Monitor if he's qualified after an assessment by the sheriff's department. 

Count 3 - 
6 months jail, consecutive to Counts 1 & 2 - STAYED -
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Allowed to serve one half on the Electornic Monitor if he's qualified after an assessment by the sheriff's department. 

Count 4 -
30 days jail, consecutive to Counts 1, 2 & 3 - STAYED -
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Allowed to serve one half on the Electornic Monitor if he's qualified after an assessment by the sheriff's department. 

Count 5 -
30 days jail, consecutive to Counts 1, 2, 3 & 4 - STAYED -
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Allowed to serve one half on the Electornic Monitor if he's qualified after an assessment by the sheriff's department. 

Placed on probation for a period of 3 years: 
Obtain AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Agent can rely on any prior AODA assessment if deemed appropriate.
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Use only 1 pharmacy to obtain prescription medications.  
Sign all necessary releases to monitor compliance with this condition.
Provide agent with list of drugs and keep it up to date on any prescriptions. 
Maintain fulltime employment. 
Coooperate with any other assessment or counseling deemed appropriate by the agent. 
No contact with victims listed in the restitution request: 
William Neeb
Kurtzweil Antiques
Grace Kulas
Jadeco Stamp and Hobby
Pay restitution of $6,791.00.  Joint and several with Shannon Meating. 
Pay costs.
Provide DNA sample if he hasn't done so already and pay the DNA surcharge. 
Court will allow early discharge if all conditions are met and restitution is paid in full. 

Atty Constable asks the JOC to reflect any payments are to be made to restitution before any fines and costs. 
Court notes that is a matter of law.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

BY THE COURT:
NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.
Bond Continued.

Defendant Joshua C Todd in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:23 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Information filed.  
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Joshua C Todd in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Time limits waived for preliminary.
Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Prior: 1430 Torun Rd, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States

$1,500 sig bond:   Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

Defendant Joshua Todd in court. ADA Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint
Defendant waives reading of Criminal Complaint
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties
Court advises defendant of right to counsel and can contact Public Defender's office for representation.

Defendant would like to consult with an attorney
Defendant can contact Public Defender for Representation
Court orders defendant to see Public Defender today. 
BTC: $1,500 sig bond:   Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
